column2: The  Court of Appeal,  after an examination of numerous authorities,
has rightly taken the view that the powers of revision vested in  the
Court  of Appeal  are  very  wide  and the  Court  can  in  a fit  case
exercise that power whether or not an appeal lies.  When,  however,
the  law does  not give  a  right of appeal and makes the  order final,

exceptional circumstances. It has been h: the  Court  of Appeal  may  nevertheless  exercise

column2: revision,  but  it  should do  so  only  in  exceptional  circumstances.

exceptional circumstances. It has been h:
Ordinarily 
the  Court  will 
not
